subsection.name: 2.1 System Requirements
subsection.p: Cayenne, including GUI tools, is written in 100% Java, and therefore should run out of the box on any Java-compatible platform. More detailed requirements are listed below:
- JDK. Cayenne tools and runtime require JDK 1.4 or higher. Download JDK from Sun at http://java.sun.com/
subsection.panel: If you are still deploying on JDK 1.3, you should switch back to Cayenne 1.1. It is fully compatible with JDK 1.3. Refer to 1.1 User Guide for extra dependencies you will need.
subsection.p:
- Access to a relational database and JDBC driver for this database. Out of the box Cayenne supports a number of databases. If your database is not on the list, there is a very good chance you can still use Cayenne with it, as long as there is a JDBC driver available. List of available JDBC drivers can be found at
http://industry.java.sun.com/products/jdbc/drivers.

- (Optional) Ant 1.6 or newer. Ant can be downloaded from http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/index.html. Ant is needed for:
cgen Ant task for class generation. An alternative to cgen is to use CayenneModeler GUI tool.
Building Cayenne from source, for instance when changing Cayenne source code to customize it for your project.

- (Optional) JavaGroups. If you plan to use remote notifications via JavaGroups transport, javagroups-*.jar must be available at runtime. It can be downloaded from here. Cayenne has been tested with JavaGroups 2.1.1.
- (Optional) JMS. If you plan to use remote notifications via JMS transport, J2EE libraries must be available at runtime, and JMS services must be running.
- (Optional) JDOM. If you use develop Swing applications with DataViews, you need to have JDOM jars installed. JDOM can be downloaded from http://www.jdom.org/.

- (Optional) Jakarta Commons Pool and DBCP. If you use DBCPDataSourceFactory for one of the DataNodes, you need commons-dbcp and commons-pool jar files that can be donwloaded from http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/. DBCP 1.2.1 and and Pool 1.2 are the tested versions.
